page.title: 15BLACKSHIELS
page.content: Blackshiels, which adjoins Fala, so that they would appear to be all the one village, contains four houses, farm buildings and a substantial sixteenth century building which is now a guest house.. On the other side of the main road is the village cemetery,which replaces the burial ground at the church. The cemetery is on the side of a right-of-way which crosses Fala moor to the village of Heriot on the A7. For the first mile of the path, there are on both sides narrow stretches of cultivated woodland, some of which was recently replanted after destruction by gale force winds in the winter of l983.
